user.biography: Guided by the vision of Rick Steves, we see travel as a powerful way to understand our world. European travel tips & dreams...🧳 🏰 🏔️ 🗺 #keepontravelin

node.text: Happy Thursday! Here's a throwback for you. We hope Rick’s flubs brighten your day as he takes you along for some blooper-reel fun, from way back in the early days of his TV show "Rick Steves' Europe" (seasons 1 and 2).

node.text:

node.text:
Season 11 of "Rick Steves' Europe" is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11!

In times of crisis and challenge, we ask ourselves: What is the true value of travel? Is it just hedonism...or something more powerful? After a lifetime of exploring Europe — and inspiring Americans to see Europe as the springboard for world exploration — Rick Steves shares his reasons why. This special episode is a sonnet to travel — an introspective love story, set in Europe, that vividly celebrates the rewards of exploring our world and the joy that awaits those who travel.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #keepontravelin #travel #happytravels #instatravel #stayandwander #neverstopexploring #seetheworld

node.title: Rick Steves' Europe: Why We Travel

node.text:
A good guidebook is a $25 tool for a $4,000 experience, and the key to smart and happy travels. But how has COVID impacted the European scene for travelers — and the reliability of guidebooks as we come out of the pandemic and begin traveling again? Rick shares his plan...  

#ricksteveseurope #keepontravelin #happytravels #ricksteves

node.title: What’s Next for Rick Steves Guidebooks?

node.text:
Season 11 of "Rick Steves' Europe" is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11!

Venturing beyond Europe, and with local experts as his guides, Rick uses Ethiopia as a classroom for understanding global hunger and extreme poverty — and how to beat it. Together, we witness the importance of water, education, empowering women, and nutrition during a child's first thousand days. And we see firsthand the impact of globalization and climate change. Our souvenir: A vivid appreciation of how ending hunger is possible — and how smart and modern development aid is the key.

node.title: Rick Steves' Europe: Ethiopia: A Development Story

node.text:
Season 11 of "Rick Steves' Europe" is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11! 
Exploring the Nile Valley from north to south, we see the highlights of Egypt. In the fabled city of Alexandria, we venture through a market wonderland, smoke a shisha, and stroll a Mediterranean promenade. In Luxor, we explore the pharaohs’ tombs and temples before sailing on a timeless felucca. Then we kick back on a riverboat cruise, enjoying iconic views of palm trees, minarets, and rustic villages. Our finale: Ramesses II's magnificent temple at Abu Simbel.

node.title: Rick Steves' Europe: Egypt's Nile, Alexandria, and Luxor

node.text: Waiting patiently for travel to ramp up again? Enjoy five minutes of goofy, giddy travel moments from our Season 11 blooper reel (a Rick Steves’ Europe TV tradition). We hope these flubs brighten your day as Rick and his TV crew ferry you from the Alps to Egypt and beyond.

node.text:
Season 11 of "Rick Steves' Europe" is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11! 

In this episode, Rick takes us to teeming Cairo, the capital of Egypt and one of the leading cities of the Muslim world. With 20 million people, greater Cairo pulses with energy. We explore the back streets on a tuk-tuk, drop in on a mosque, haggle with a gauntlet of eager merchants, bake some pita bread, help chisel a tombstone, marvel at King Tut’s gold, greet the ancient Sphinx, and climb into the center of the greatest pyramid.

node.text:
Season 11 of "Rick Steves' Europe" is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11! 

Traveling across Germany, we learn how fascism rose and then fell, taking millions of people with it. Visiting actual locations — from Munich to Nürnberg to Berlin — we trace the roots of Nazism in the aftermath of World War I, when masses of angry people were enchanted by Hitler. We explore the totalitarian society Hitler built, and see the consequences: genocide and total war. Learning from Germany's fascist story, we can recognize that hateful ideology as well as the tricks of wannabe dictators in our own age.

node.title: Rick Steves' Europe: Germany’s Fascist Story

node.text:
Season 11 of "Rick Steves' Europe" is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11! 

In this episode, we soar to new heights in France with Rick Steves. After exploring the proud cuisine capital of Lyon — which, at least in its own mind, rivals Paris — we head for Chamonix, in the shadow of one of Europe’s tallest peaks: Mont Blanc. With the classic alpine resort as our springboard, we make some high-altitude cheese, then ride the lift up to Aiguille du Midi and over to the border of Italy. And we hike the Tour du Mont Blanc — the trail that circles that iconic mountain.

#ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #france #frenchalps #lyon #happytravels #keepontravelin #travel

node.title: Rick Steves' Europe: French Alps and Lyon

node.text:
Season 11 is now available for streaming on our YouTube channel and on our website at www.ricksteves.com/season11!

Join Rick in Switzerland, which draws travelers from around the world for its legendary mountains. From the Matterhorn to the Jungfrau to Appenzell, we savor both the country's jaw-dropping alpine beauty and the rich and resilient culture of its people. As we lace together that dramatic mountain wonder with scenic train rides, breathtaking lifts, and unforgettable hikes, we also enjoy alpine life — from exploring glaciers to making cheese the old-fashioned way.

#ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #switzerland #happytravels #keepontravelin

node.text: Happy Thursday! Here's a throwback for you. We hope Rick’s flubs brighten your day as he takes you along for some blooper-reel fun, from way back in the early days of his TV show "Rick Steves' Europe" (seasons 1 and 2).

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Vienna, Austria with @visitaustria. May be an image of outdoors and monument.

node.text:
Off-season adventures come with a bevy of benefits, from cheaper airfare to a less-crowded Europe to cooler temperatures. Some European destinations are better than others for travel in November through March. Get inspired and check out our list of our best off-season getaways and winter escapes at ricksteves.com/tours. 

📸: @dominicbonuccelli, photographer
.
.
.
.

.
.

#keepontravelin #happytravels #ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #rickstevestours #winterescape #vienna #austria #hofburgpalace #wien

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Julian Alps - Slovenia with @feelslovenia. May be an image of nature, body of water and tree.

node.text:
To top off your Slovenian mountain experience, head for the hills. The northwestern corner of Slovenia — within yodeling distance of Austria and Italy — is crowned by the Julian Alps. The Slovenian mountainsides are laced with hiking paths, blanketed in deep forests, and speckled with ski resorts and vacation chalets. Beyond every ridge is a peaceful alpine village nestled around a quaint Baroque steeple. As you curl on twisty roads between the cut-glass peaks, you'll enjoy stunning high-mountain scenery, whitewater rivers with superb fishing, rustic rest stops, thought-provoking WWI sights, and charming hamlets.

📸: Cameron Hewitt, guidebook co-author
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#keepontravelin #happytravels #ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #slovenia #socariver #wanderlust #ifeelslovenia #stayandwander #optoutside #mojaslovenija

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Míkonos. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Mykonos is the very picture of the perfect Greek island town: a humble seafront village crouched behind a sandy harbor, thickly layered with blinding-white stucco, bright-blue trim, and bursting-purple bougainvilleas. Mykonos' status as a fashionable, jet-set destination and a mecca for gay holiday makers also gives it a certain hip cachet (and sky-high prices) — weary fisherfolk and tacky trinket stalls share the lanes with top-end fashion boutiques. The core of town is literally a maze, designed by the Mykonians centuries ago to discourage would-be invaders from finding their way. If you manage to break free, wander up to the windmills for the view, or head to one of the many enticing sandy beaches around the island.

📸: Rick Steves
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#keepontravelin #happytravels #ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #greece #mykonos #mediterranean #europe #stayandwander #wanderlust #travel #instatravel

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Manarola with @italiait, and @italy. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
In Italy's Cinque Terre, mellow Manarola fills a ravine, bookended by its wild little harbor to the west and a diminutive hilltop church square inland to the east. Manarola is exception for being unexceptional: While Vernazza is prettier, Monterosso glitzier, Riomaggiore bigger, and Corniglia more rustic, Manarola hits a fine balance, giving it the "just right" combination of Cinque Terre qualities. Perhaps that's why it's a favorite among savvy Europeans seeking a relatively untrampled home base. 

Manarola, whose hillsides are blanketed with vineyards, also provides the easiest access to the Cinque Terre's remarkable dry-stone terraces. The trail ringing the town's cemetery peninsula, adjacent to the main harbor, provides some of the most strikingly beautiful town views anywhere in the region.

You can hike through the Cinque Terre on our Heart of Italy in 9 days tour, where we give you a free day to wander through the five villages at your own pace. For more information, please visit www.ricksteves.com/tours. 

📸: @salvarado24, tour assistant on Heart of Italy in 9 Days 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#keepontravelin #happytravels #ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #heartofitaly #italy #italia #cinqueterre #manarola #travel #instatravel #stayandwander #seetheworld #wanderlust

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Barcelona, Spain. May be an image of outdoors and monument.

node.text:
You can enjoy the freedom in deciding your own daily sightseeing priorities and pace on a Rick Steves My Way® tour. We deal with the logistics to make your travel dreams a smooth and affordable reality, providing comfortable rooms in centrally located hotels, private bus transportation from city to city, all breakfasts, a guidebook relevant to your itinerary, and a Euro-savvy tour manager to advise you along the way. But the choice is yours on what sights to see and when to see them, and you can choose to make your days as leisurely or jam-packed as you wish.

Imagine wandering through Barcelona's maze of streets in the Gothic Quarter, or across open meadows in the Swiss Alps. Eat your way through a Saturday morning farmer's market in a small town in France, or enjoy a sunset Aperol Spritz at a seaside café in Italy's Cinque Terre. The choice on how you experience Europe on a My Way® tour is yours!

Discover where our My Way® tours can take you to by visiting our website (2022 tour dates are now available): https://www.ricksteves.com/tours/my-way-european-vacations

📸: Cameron Hewitt, guidebook co-author
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#keepontravelin #rickstevestours #ricksteves #ricksteveseurope #happytravels #barcelona #spain

node.text: Happy #TravelTuesday everyone! Here's a throwback of Rick and fellow tour guide Cristina Duarte (@anatinocas_) hanging out in Lisbon. Join in on the fun and post your favorite travel destination in your "Keep on Travelin'" t-shirt (and don't forget to use the #keepontravelin hashtag!)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Abbaye Notre-Dame de Sénanque with @super_france, and @francefr. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text:
Deep in the south of France, Provence offers an almost predictable palette of travel experiences: oceans of vineyards, fields of scented lavender, adorable villages, and intoxicating bouillabaisse. Provençal life feels rooted in its countryside, small towns, and vibrant markets. Its famous fields of lavender and sunflowers inspire painters. Here, the five hectares of lavender fields that surround the Abbey Notre-Dame de Sénanque, near Gordes, make for breathtaking pictures.

📸: Paul Orcutt

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Mürren. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Pleasant as an alpine resort can be, Mürren is traffic-free and filled with cafés, souvenirs, old-timers with walking sticks, employees enjoying incentive trips, and snap-happy tourists. Its chalets are prefab-rustic. With help from a cliffside train, a funicular, and a cable car, hiking options are endless from Mürren. Sitting on a ledge 2,000 feet (about 600 meters) above the Lauterbrunnen Valley, surrounded by a fortissimo chorus of mountains, the town has all the comforts of home (for a price) without the pretentiousness of more famous resorts.

📸: @dominicbonuccelli, photographer

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Millennium Bridge, London with @london, @visitlondon, and @lovegreatbritain. May be an image of outdoors and monument.

node.text:
This pedestrian bridge, called Millennium Bridge, links St. Paul’s Cathedral and the Tate Modern across the Thames. London’s first new bridge in a century. When it opened in 2000, the $25 million bridge wiggled when people walked on it, so it promptly closed for repairs; 20 months and $8 million later, it reopened. Nicknamed the “blade of light” for its sleek minimalist design (370 yards long, four yards wide, stainless steel with teak planks), its clever aerodynamic handrails deflect wind over the heads of pedestrians.

📸: @dominicbonuccelli, photographer

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Melk with @visitaustria. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
Melk’s restored abbey, beaming proudly over the Danube Valley, is one of Europe’s great sights. Established as a fortified Benedictine abbey (Benediktinerstift) in the 11th century, it was later destroyed by fire. During an 18th-century Baroque building boom, the ruling Habsburgs commissioned architect Jakob Prandtauer to remake the abbey buildings. 

The abbey church, with its 200-foot-tall dome and symmetrical towers, dominates the complex--emphasizing its sacred purpose. The gilded church, restored in 1996 to celebrate the 1,000th anniversary of the first reference to a country named Österreich (Austria), is a grand Baroque dream.

You can see this iconic Baroque gem for yourself on our 12 Day Berlin, Prague, and Vienna tour, before taking a relaxing cruise along Austria's prettiest stretch of the Danube River, the Wachau Valley, to Vienna. Learn more at ricksteves.com/tours.

📸: @dominicbonuccelli, photographer

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Rick Steves' Europe in Dingle Peninsula with @tourismireland. May be an image of coast and nature.

node.text:
The Dingle Peninsula, the westernmost tip of Ireland (and Europe, for that matter), offers just the right mix of far-and-away beauty, isolated walks and bike rides, and ancient archaeological wonders — all within convenient reach of its main town. 

You can discover this beautiful corner of the Emerald Isle on our Heart of Ireland in 8 Days — Rick's personal "best of" distillation of our two-week Best of Ireland tour. Learn more about this tour and see what 2022 dates we have available on our website at ricksteves.com/tours/ireland. 🍀 

📸: @dominicbonuccelli, photographer
